The climate is tropical in Samut Songkhram. In Samut Songkhram, the precipitation during summers is significantly higher in comparison to winters. According to Köppen and Geiger, this climate is classified as Aw. The temperature in this location is approximately 27.8 °C | 82.0 °F, as determined by statistical analysis. About 1200 mm | 47.2 inch of precipitation falls annually.

Climate graph // Weather by Month Samut Songkhram

The driest month is December. There is 12 mm | 0.5 inch of precipitation in December. The maximum quantity of rainfall is observed during the month of September, exhibiting an average value of 224 mm | 8.8 inch.

average temperature by month Samut Songkhram

With an average of 29.7 °C | 85.5 °F, April is the warmest month. During the month of January, there is a notable drop in temperature, with an average low of approximately 26.0 °C | 78.9 °F.

The precipitation varies 212 mm | 8 inch between the driest month and the wettest month. The degree of fluctuation in the yearly temperature is approximately 3.7 °C | 6.7 °F.

In terms of relative humidity, the month that exhibits the highest level is October with a percentage of 63.56. Conversely, December has been recorded as having the lowest amount of relative humidity at only 63.56. It is noteworthy that September has the highest number of rainy days, amounting to 23.53, whereas the month with the least rainfall is December, experiencing only 2.40 wet days.

On average, the location of Samut Songkhram records the highest number of daily sunshine hours during July. The mean duration of sunlight per day in this month is approximately 10.2, with a total cumulative count reaching up to 316.3.

On average, Samut Songkhram records the lowest daily sunshine hours in January. During this period, there is an average of 8.81 hours of sunlight per day and a total accumulation of 264.33 hours.

Throughout the year, a total of 3513.82 hours of light are recorded in the location of Samut Songkhram. The monthly average for sunlight is approximately 115.54 hours.

The average annual water temperature of Gulf of Thailand in the city of Samut Songkhram is recorded to be approximately 29.10°C | 84.38°F.

When the water content reaches 30.90°C | 87.62°F, it is observed that during May of each year, there is a significant increase in the average monthly temperature. Conversely, around 26.50°C | 79.70°F, particularly in January, we observe an opposite trend where temperatures hit their lowest point.

At its highest, the water temperature reaches around 30.90°C | 87.62°F in the year on May 02. The lowest value is around 26.50°C | 79.70°F, which occurs on approximately January 01.

The body of water in closest proximity to Samut Songkhram is identified as the Gulf of Thailand.
